item.title: 3D Vectors and Shapes
item.description: 3D Coordinate System ![[Examples/Calc 2/3d vectors 1.png]] theoretically adding more dimensions looks the same, we just can’t draw them 3D Vectors Everything we have learned about [[Vectors]] already transfers over

item.title: Cross Product
item.description: Cross Product Cross Product is another operation that can be done on two vectors. The result of doing the cross product is another vector

item.title: Dot Product
item.description: Dot Products Given 2 vectors, $\vec{u} = < u_{1}, u_{2}, u_{3}>$ and $\vec{v} = <v_{1}, v_{2}, v_{3}>$ the dot product is $\vec{u}\cdot\vec{v} = u_{1}v_{1}+u_{2}v_{2}+u_{3}v_{3}$

item.title: Vectors
item.description: Vectors Scalars: (numbers) 5, -13, $\pi$ etc have magnitude only no sense of directions Compare to vectors, for example, I am traveling at 65 mph north There’s a sense of magnitude - 65 mph and a sense of direction - north Mathematically, vectors are represented by arrows
